item.title: Jon add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Though much is taken, much abides; and though We are not now that strength which in old days Moved earth and heaven, that which we are, we are; One equal temper of heroic hearts, Made weak by time and fate, but strong in will To strive, to seek, to find, and not to yield." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Jon add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Information is not knowledge. Knowledge is not wisdom. Wisdom is not truth. Truth is not beauty. Beauty is not love. Love is not music. Music is THE BEST." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Jon add a quote by William Shakespeare
Jon add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Jon add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Jon add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "Most marriages don't add two people together. They subtract one from the other." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Jon add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "The gain to the winner is always less than the loss to the loser." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Jon add a quote by C. A. R. Hoare
item.description: "There are two ways of constructing a software design: One way is to make it so simple that there are obviously no deficiencies, and the other way is to make it so complicated that there are no obvious deficiencies. The first method is far more difficult." -- C. A. R. Hoare

item.title: Jon add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters
